revised_title: Precise Measurements of Slow Electron Diffusion in Nitrogen and Hydrogen
tldr: This article presents the results of precise measurements of slow electron diffusion in hydrogen and nitrogen under the influence of a uniform electric field. The authors deduce physical quantities such as mean free path, mean energy loss per collision, and collisional cross-sections of the molecules. The findings contribute to understanding related fields of study, such as high-frequency discharges, microwave discharges, the positive column, and the ionosphere.
